title: Palin hires someone to work with her book

content: Your personal opinions of the woman is noted... but to claim that she was selected by anybody else other than Mccain is highly unlikely. Mccain is and always has been a hardheaded do it my way senator with a bad temper... geared with a one track mine, who is very persuasive in his pursuit of what he believes in amongst his peers, but isn't a very good stump speaker. If he didn't want Palin on the ticket it would never have happened. With all due respect to his military service and his suffering for this country I say this with true belief that Mccain (in my opinion) defeated himself when it came to gathering support from the Republican Party and the independent voters. He was a favorite son of the centralist, sometimes praised as much by the left as by the right, while others viewed him as too much like Bush or at lease associated with his policies. Palin was nothing more than an easy target for the media while Mccain was not. Palin's like of experience in the political arena of Washington and the liberal press... Along with Mccain's handlers introducing her unwisely .... totally unprepared was Mccain's decision, not hers since she was not ready to play hardball with her adversaries. This doesn't make her a joke as you concluded, but ignorant of the backstabbing which goes on between the two political parties in bigtime politics as well as the biases of the liberal news media for anyone that disagrees with their political agenda. Was she ready for big time cut throat politics? No question she was not, but the fault lied in Mccain and his advisers, not in the appointed candidate. If she gets her act straight you may be hearing from her in the future in politics. I suspect if you do hear from her again she'll be a much wiser political candidate who has learn the art of dirty Cut-throat politics. An opinion

content: quote: Originally posted by RRR52: quote: Originally posted by Bleah: There doesn't seem to be a lot to tell. born, grew up. hunted moose. fished. popped out a few kids. watched kids play hockey became mayor became governor ****ed off liberals for a few months. [She still does, although it is less angering the media mavens of the left than causing them concern due to her appeal to Americans respectful of the Founders' purposes in creating the new nation.] A life just like anybody else in America?!? But she is pretty straightforward and uncomplicated, which gives her a good deal of appeal to honest, direct, competent, unpretentious people. The standard conservative WHINE whenever they don't like what the media says. (Said while crying) But but the media (by which they mean BIG BUSINESSES out to make a profit) are biased that is why they are so mean to us.

content: quote: Originally posted by Ol_Doc: I'm not a Palin fan but this is not a story. How many politicians have hired writers to help them with books? Quite a few I believe. You are correct Doc, this is just something people are trying to use to tear her down even more. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
